description: Entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the mass density of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound (higher = more diverse).
Entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the heat of fusion (fusion enthalpy) of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound (higher = more diverse).
Entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the valence electron count of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound (higher = more diverse).
Entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the atomic radius of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound (higher = more diverse).
Entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the first ionization energy of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound (higher = more diverse).
Unweighted geometric mean of the mass density of constituent elements in the compound.
Unweighted geometric mean of the electron affinity of constituent elements in the compound.
Unweighted geometric mean of the valence electron count of constituent elements in the compound.
Unweighted arithmetic mean of the mass density of constituent elements in the compound.
Unweighted arithmetic mean of the valence electron count of constituent elements in the compound.
Number of distinct chemical elements present in the compound.
Range (max minus min) of the thermal conductivity of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Range (max minus min) of the atomic radius of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Range (max minus min) of the first ionization energy of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Standard deviation of the mass density of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Standard deviation of the thermal conductivity of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Standard deviation of the atomic mass of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Standard deviation of the atomic radius of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the mass density of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the heat of fusion (fusion enthalpy) of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the thermal conductivity of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the valence electron count of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the atomic mass of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted entropy-like measure of how heterogeneous the atomic radius of constituent elements are across different elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted geometric mean of the thermal conductivity of constituent elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted geometric mean of the valence electron count of constituent elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted arithmetic mean of the thermal conductivity of constituent elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted arithmetic mean of the valence electron count of constituent elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted arithmetic mean of the atomic mass of constituent elements in the compound.
Range-like measure of the valence electron count of constituent elements, taking stoichiometric fractions into account.
Range-like measure of the atomic mass of constituent elements, taking stoichiometric fractions into account.
Range-like measure of the first ionization energy of constituent elements, taking stoichiometric fractions into account.
Atomic-fraction-weighted standard deviation of the electron affinity of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted standard deviation of the thermal conductivity of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted standard deviation of the valence electron count of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted standard deviation of the atomic radius of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
Atomic-fraction-weighted standard deviation of the first ionization energy of constituent elements among the elements in the compound.
